content.question: Greenberg’s argument most differs from Hietala’s in that Greenberg claims that

choices.label: race was a defining factor in the tensions leading up to the Mexican-American War
pioneers, not politicians, were a major factor in building the American empire
most Americans believed that Mexicans in the new territories could not assimilate
the granting of citizenship to people in the territories was welcomed by many Americans after the war

content.answer: most Americans believed that Mexicans in the new territories could not assimilate

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Compare the arguments or main ideas of two sources.
